column5: Can’t tell from the picture if the wind is blowing but if not, looks like a beautiful day up there. We are missing the snow and just rain all day down here. Still early but it’s been a mild winter here.
Alittle humor on here and some fun goes along ways,,nowadays,,,,,,thanks hooks.
Have had wind everyday making it feel colder on exposed skin.Cant complain as it's been fairly good winter.But time to have a spring change.Iam ready for it.
Rich if you need alittle exercise,come on over,I got a extra shovel!! we're in the eye of the storm.
Had to head into Vermilion Bay today and as usuall I always go to the lake for a veiw.Cold today but a blue sky with sun.Drove out on lake today as it was plowed for the ice derby.So different veiw
Your truck is probably sitting right on top of some huge fish,rumor has it VB is loaded with monsters!
You kill me.Actually not a great spot.BUT 100 yds further out is very famous muskie area that does hold some spring walleye to.

We are going to get 12 to 15 inches snow tonight through noon Thursday,that gives you time to bring your wheeler with the plow on it down here,American plan at my place john,no charge,everything is a freebie.lol
It will melt shortly after.Just plowed today.we got couple of inches but wind put some drifts in the yard so tuned that up today.
Have you two ever heard of "email". It's like sending notes to each other but you do it on your computer..... ...and nobody sees it!
Sorry to see that our posting bothers you Gord.I can only suggest not to open them if you see our names attached.

I've heard of emails and I just checked into it,that's some hi-tech stuff,setting up account n password that's not the route to go for me.Everything I need to get done in life is right through WC,no better place in the world to be,other than vermillion bay from what I understand,looking forward to fishing eagle n VB in the future,I've learned a lot on WC even how to BS,but the greatest thing I ever learned in life was not in school,my father taught me how to tie a jig on.

Gord, as usual, perhaps you better check your own WC posts before you speak. We have learned and awful lot about you (flamingo flocks, yoga pants, your stance on vaxes, etc.) through your intimate conversations with Pat. I, for one, have enjoyed the banter. Fish On! Hooks
